title: E-mail login and only 7 days of history
content:
First and most important I want to thank FredMcD and cor-el. Your input got me "going" again.

E-mail is the more important issue at this point. I use Gmail and have for years, and right now I have to go through their awkward login procedure every time I start Firefox. In Safari, which I want to leave behind, I just click on mail and I'm in. Can I setup this situation in Firefox?

My history only shows "Today", "Yesterday", "Last 7 days". I don't want to show a ton of history, but I would like to show 14 days. In some of the help articles I see far more history than that. Is there any way I can push history to 14 days?

Help would be greatly appreciated as I'm 78 and weak on technology, chubbles
creator: chubbles

title: update 98 not useable
content: i use an Asus PC running win7 for live streaming web sites such as news sites. It is NOT this PC i write this message on. It has been fine until update 98.0 was applied. Now its unusable for live streaming from websites. Video does not play constantly. It runs then freezes, runs then freezes all the time but the audio continues. Its like this with all the websites i stream from which were fine before this update 98.0. If i go to Chrome, they stream fine. Whats happened with this update to cause this issue?

title: "forwarding notice" on Google picture search
content:
When I am on Google and searching "Pictures" and then I click on a link to the website of a certain picture, Firefox shows me a stupid warning page. In German it is calle "Weiterleitungshinweis" (= "forwarding notice"?) It gives me a warning that I am going to that other website (I actually CLICKED on the link to get there!) and askes me if I want to return to the google page. WTF??? I cannot get rid of it. It is SOO annoying. I even started FF in "safe mode" (without addons) and it's still there.

When I use Chrome it is not there. But FF is my favourite Browser. So, how can I get rid of that annoying feature??

Thank you!
creator: lopy

title: Opened files no longer going to temp folder
content: It used to be that when I clicked a MPEG Audio file link I would get a prompt that asked if I wanted to save or open. When I chose open the media would play in my media player from the temp folder and then get deleted later on automatically. Now however when I select open the file gets placed in my downloads folder and then plays. I have to go manually delete these files if I don't want them on my hard drive. I've already gone into Troubleshooting Information, Profile Folder, to delete the handlers.json file to hopefully get it to reset but it still doesn't send opened files to the temp folder. Any other ideas?

title: Bookmarks
content:
Last week Firefox just quit browsing. After much frustration, I just uninstalled and reinstalled Firefox. Now it seems that Firefox will NOT bookmark properly. After doing a normal bookmark, the blue star shows in the URL line but I can NOT find the newly linked URL where I put it. However, if I export the bookmarks to a html backup file, the new bookmarks appear in the backup file exactly where I put it.

I tried Firefox Help, the instructions, "Can't add, change or save bookmarks - How to fix | Firefox Help" did not help. The places.sqlite file was unchecked for Read Only. Trying to create a new bookmark file seemed overwhelming.

I lost most of a day when Firefox quit browsing. After discovering this bookmark problem, I have spent over an hour trying to solve it. And I fear there are other problems ahead as well. Having used Firefox for years, I just do not want to go to Chrome or Edge (aaarrrghhh), but I can't afford the lost time.

Is there a real (and simple) solution to this bookmark problem? Please help!
creator: ralphwhittle
